Posts.Content: Hey Shreddedwolf I'm a newbie also but have come to realize like Fairwind said ... Every case is different. I picked up a copy of Dr. Pat Walsh's book "Surviving Prostate Cancer" and have read most of it. Stay positive and informed!!! Best Wishes

Posts.Title: New to Forums! 56 Year old with stage IV prostate cancer (bone mets)

Posts.Content: Thanks everybody for the Good advice. As you probably know it's kind of sets you back when hear the word "CANCER". I'm anxious to hear what my urologist has to say Thursday. A little more history about myself is my father and uncle have both had PC and had theirs removed about 20 years ago. I've worked at a chemical plant for almost 30 years and we get a physical once a year and blood work twice a year my PSA looks like this over the last 10 years 07-.8 08-.9 09-1.1 10-1.3 11-1.0 12-1.2 13-1.4 14-1.7 15-1.7 16-2.1 I had just had my yearly physical in Aug. and the plants doctor did not feel anything. I was having some discomfort in my scrotum and he suggested that I see my urologist. He did a DRE also and found the nodule. Still not sure what was causing the discomfort but it has pretty much went away for the most part. He also found blood in my urine which didn't surprise me because I have a past history of kidney stones and was thinking that might be what was causing the discomfort. He order a CT scan which came back neg. but did find some stones in both kidneys but nothing that should cause me any pain right now. Then me did the biopsy after that he scoped my bladder and said it looked fine. That's pretty much how I've got to this point. I appreciate any advice or guidance I can get.
Posts.Signature: 55 yrs. old PSA-2.1 DRE- Nodule found 9/28/2016 Biopsy-10/20/2016 11 came back Benign 1-right middle came back atypical Biopsy- 11/02/2016 Biopsy sent to John Hopkins 11-samples Benign 1-right middle Adenocarcinoma 3+3 <5%

Posts.Title: Searching for the right treatment

Posts.Content: I've been newly diagnosed with prostate cancer and trying to figure out the best course of treatment. I meet with the surgeon 12/01/2016 to discuss my options with him but he's already said he'd opt for surgery. I'd appreciate any help I can get. I live in far western Kentucky about 2 hours from Nashville Tn. and 3 hours from St. Louis Mo. if I need to travel to get the treatment I need.

Posts.Content: Thanks again for all the advice. From what I've read and from the advice that I've gotten here AS is probably the right option for me now. I just want to now what all the options are things get worse. One thing I'd like to know about is FLA " Focal Laser Ablation. Has any one had this done or know someone who has?
